===Etymology===
Applied in late 19th century Taiwan during Qing rule. ''Pingpu'' {{zh-l|平埔族}} and ''Gaoshan'' {{zh-l|高山族}} were used interchangeably with the epithets "cooked" {{zh-l|熟番}} and "raw" {{zh-l|生番}}
